intro: Anulocaulis leiosolenus var. typicus, commonly known as the velvetleaf hibiscus, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses in warm climates.
